summary: The module defines PyTorch neural‑network layers that automatically build graph structures from collections of point coordinates. It offers three graph‑generation strategies: (1) connecting each point to its k‑nearest neighbors (including self‑loops) with batch‑aware indexing, (2) linking points that lie within a specified radius using a configurable Minkowski metric and optional self‑loops, and (3) assembling graphs from multiple point sets by concatenating them and applying k‑nearest neighbor connections with appropriate node ID offsets. A lightweight helper computes pairwise squared distances to support these constructions.
business_intent: Facilitate the preprocessing of geometric or point‑cloud data into graph formats required by graph neural network models, providing efficient, batched, and configurable neighbor‑search utilities within the DGL‑PyTorch ecosystem.
